question: Catecholamines are derived from which of the following amino acids?
Which of the following is the most common pituitary disease?

While reading the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) report of a hypertensive patient, a radiologist noted that a vascular lesion was affecting the hypophyseal portal system. Which artery forms this portal system?
Which of the following is the obligatory and intermediate lipophilic and hydrophobic hormone in the biosynthesis of both estradiol and dihydrotestosterone?
When is zona reticularis developed?

answers.option: In sixth month of fetal life
In fifth month of fetal life
In third month of fetal life
In ninth month of fetal life

question: A 40-year-old lady comes to the outpatient department with a painful swelling on the neck. She has high T3 and T4 and her TSH is diminished. The thyroid gland is tender and palpable. What is the most likely cause of her thyrotoxicosis?
What is the most common cause of iodine deficiency in Pakistan?

answers.option: Too much usage of iodine in the body

question: Diabetes insipidus is caused by deficiency of which hormone?
The histological section of neurohypophysis shows supporting cells and axons with dilated terminal ends. What are the supporting cells and dilated terminal ends of axons called?
Where is the pituitary gland present relative to the optic chiasm?
Steroid hormones work by which of the following mechanisms?
Which serum prolactin level is used as a differential for macroprolactinoma diagnosis?

A newborn is brought into the emergency department with complaints of intolerance of oral feeding and greenish vomiting. Radiography shows duodenal obstruction with stomach dilation. Which of the following situations is most likely in the case mentioned above?

A patient comes into the outpatient department with severe pain in the epigastrium radiating to the back. After examination and investigation, a diagnosis of inflammation of the pancreas is made on the basis of increased levels of digestive enzymes from the exocrine part of the pancreas. Which of the following cells of the affected part of the gland are responsible for increased enzyme levels?

A 32-year-old female presents with a history of palpitation, diarrhea, and weight loss for one month. Examination reveals bulging eyes that are exophthalmic in appearance. Blood tests reveal elevated levels of antibodies against the thyroid tissue, indicating Grave's disease. Which of the following features does the hyperactive follicle of the affected gland have?

A patient comes into the clinic with a complaint of swelling in front of the neck. After examinations and investigations, a diagnosis of an enlarged thyroid gland was made. Which of the following does the enlarged gland develop from?
During the developmental process of the adrenal gland, which of the following would lead to the formation of chromaffin cells?
Which of the following is consistent with a decreased rate of ACTH secretion?

answers.option: Stress as a result of emotional trauma

question: As part of a routine clinical examination, a patient’s serum electrolyte levels were measured. Among the measurements, it was determined that the total plasma calcium concentration was 10.2 mg/dL. What percentage of total plasma calcium is normally present as the free active Ca+ ion?
Which of the following gives rise to the anterior part of the pituitary gland?
How does the adrenal gland regulate blood pressure?

answers.option: Cortisol which is released by zona fasciculata

question: Which of the following most likely results in a decreased release of aldosterone?

answers.option: Decreased Na+ concentration at macula densa
An increase in renin secretion by kidney
A fall in mean arterial blood pressure
A rise in mean arterial blood pressure

question: A 30-year-old woman completed a routine pregnancy with the uncomplicated delivery of a normal-sized baby girl 6 months ago. The woman is currently experiencing galactorrhea (persistent discharge of milk-like secretions from the breast) and has not yet resumed regular menstrual periods. The baby had been bottle-fed since birth. What is the most likely explanation of the galactorrhea?
Which of the following hormonal treatments would provide the greatest therapeutic benefit in patients with acromegaly?

A 40-year-old man complains of chronic fatigue, aching muscles, and occasional numbness in his fingers. Physical examination reveals a modest weight gain but no goiter is detected. Laboratory findings include TSH >10 uU/L (normal range, 0.5 to 5 uU/L); free T4, low to low-normal. Which of the following are these findings most consistent with?

answers.option: Hyperthyroidism as a result of autoimmune thyroid disease
Hyperthyroidism secondary to a hypothalamic-pituitary defect
Hypothyroidism as a result of autoimmune thyroid disease
Hypothyroidism secondary to a hypothalamic-pituitary defect
Hypothyroidism as a result of iodine deficiency

question: Which of the following receptors are responsible for mediating the lipolytic effect of catecholamines?

The emergency room receives a 2-month-old boy with worsening "floppiness" and poor eating. The baby was born vaginally to a 38-year-old lady. The parents call the baby a "good baby" who rarely cries and sleeps through the night but has been hard to wake for breastfeeding. Stools are now tiny and pellet-like. Examination reveals a hypotonic child with a big tongue, anterior fontanelle, and reducible umbilical hernia. Which of the following conditions is the infant suffering from?
Increase in which of the following actions of catecholamine on the cardiovascular system is mediated by alpha receptors only?

A postpartum 24-year-old with gestational diabetes requests a follow-up. Diet alone controls her blood glucose 12 weeks after giving birth. Her fasting glucose is 100-120 mg/dL. Her medical history is otherwise normal. Vitals, BMI, and physical exam are normal. Her gestational diabetes and fasting hyperglycemia are likely genetic. Which enzyme's reduced activity is likely responsible?
Which of the following transporters does glucose use to enter the pancreatic beta cells in response to hypoglycemia?
Which hormone functions as the second line of defence to prevent hypoglycemia?
Which of the following provides glucose to muscles during exercise?
Which of the following is responsible for the down-regulation of a receptor in the presence of an excess of a hormone?
Which of the following increases the secretion of growth hormone from the anterior pituitary gland?
Which of the following is the normal constituent of urine?
What does 'decreased glucose tolerance' mean?

answers.option: Decreased ability to absorb glucose from diet
Following a glucose load, the body responds by hypoglycemia
Increased ability to absorb glucose from diet
Following a glucose load, the body responds by hyperglycemia

question: A 21-year-old girl visits the clinic complaining of drowsiness, weight gain, puffiness of the face, and menstrual irregularities. The doctor advises some blood tests and she is diagnosed with hypothyroidism. The doctor prescribes her thyroxin as a treatment. Through which of the following does thyroxin act?

answers.option: Stimulation of enzyme synthesis at ribosome level
Direct activation at the enzyme level

question: A 38-year-old male visits the clinic with complaints of weight gain and weakness of muscles. On examination, he has thin arms and legs, purplish bruises over the abdomen and hip region, and a round face. After performing some blood tests he is diagnosed with Cushing syndrome. Which of the following electrolytes would the report show to be increased in this patient?
Which of the following would NOT increase during starvation?

Glucagon is a water-soluble hormone that binds to high-affinity receptors on cell membranes of hepatocytes. It activates a cascade of phosphorylation that leads to the formation of second messengers. Which of the following second messengers does glucagon lead to the formation of?
Which of the following hormones has inhibitory effects on the release of secretin and cholecystokinin?

A 40-year-old man comes into the outpatient department because of weight loss, increased appetite, and diplopia. On physical examination, his temperature is 37.7° C, pulse is 106/min, respiration rate is 15/min, and blood pressure is 140/80 mmHg. A fine tremor is observed in his outstretched hand. He has bilateral proptosis. The serum laboratory findings include a serum TSH level of 0.1 pU/mL. A radioiodine scan indicates increased diffuse uptake throughout the thyroid, Which of the following best describes the microscopic appearance of the patient's thyroid gland?

answers.option: Enlarged thyroid follicles lined by flattened epithelial cells
Papillary projections in thyroid follicles and lymphoid aggregates in the stroma
Nodules with nests of cells separated by hyaline stroma that stains with Congo red
Destruction of follicles, lymphoid aggregates, and Hurthle cell metaplasia
Follicular destruction with inflammatory infiltrates containing giant cells

question: A 30-year-old man visits the hospital because he has had a headache, weakness, and a 5-kg weight gain over the last 4 months. On physical examination, his face is puffy. His temperature is 36.9°C, pulse is 79/min, and blood pressure is 160/75 mm Hg while lying down. He has cutaneous striae over the lower abdomen and ecchymoses scattered over the extremities. A radiograph of the spine shows a compressed fracture of T11. Laboratory findings show a fasting plasma glucose level of 200 mg/dL, the plasma cortisol level is 38 pg/dL at 8:00 am and 37 pg/dL at 6:00 pm. Which of the following conditions is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Adenoma of the right adrenal cortex without atrophy of contralateral adrenal cortex
Small-cell carcinoma of the lung with bilateral hyperplasia of the adrenal cortex
Corticotroph adenoma of the anterior pituitary with bilateral hyperplasia of the adrenal cortex
Corticotroph adenoma of the anterior pituitary, medullary carcinoma of thyroid, and bilateral nodular hyperplasia of the adrenal cortex
Adenoma of the right adrenal cortex with atrophy of the contralateral adrenal cortex

question: A 40-year-old man visits the physician due to weakness and easy fatiguability for 2 months. On physical examination, there are no remarkable findings. Laboratory studies show serum calcium of 11.5 mg/dl, inorganic phosphorus of 2.4 mg/dl, and parathyroid hormone of 54 pg/ml, which is near the top of the reference range. Radionuclear bone scan fails to show any uptake. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 35-year-old woman presents with complaints of feeling of fullness in her neck but has no other complaints. The enlargement has been gradual and painless for more than 1 year. Physical examination confirms diffuse enlargement of the thyroid gland without any apparent masses. Laboratory studies of thyroid function show a normal free T4 level and a slightly increased TSH level. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 23-year-old, previously healthy woman died suddenly after complaining of a mild sore throat the previous day. At autopsy, her adrenal glands are enlarged, and there are extensive bilateral cortical hemorrhages. Which of the following organisms best accounts for these findings?

A 32-year-old woman with systemic lupus erythematosus has been treated with corticosteroid therapy for several years, because of recurrent lupus nephritis. While on vacation, she undergoes an emergency appendectomy for acute appendicitis. On postoperative day 2, she becomes somnolent and develops severe nausea and vomiting. She then becomes hypotensive. Blood cultures are negative, and laboratory studies now show Na+ of 128 mmol/L, K+ of 4.9 mmol/L, Cl- of 89 mmol/L, CO2 of 19 mmol/L, glucose of 52 mg/dL, and creatinine of 1.3 mg/dL. Which of the following morphologic findings in the adrenal glands is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Solitary 1-cm adenoma without atrophy of the contralateral adrenal cortex

question: A 42-year-old man sees his physician because he has had polyuria and polydipsia for the last 4 months. His medical history shows that he fell off a ladder and hit his head just before the onset of these problems. On physical examination, there are no specific findings. Laboratory findings include serum Na+, 155 mmol/L; K+, 3.9 mmol/L; Cl-, 111 mmol/L; C02,27 mmol/L; glucose 84 mg/dL; creatinine, 1 mg/dL; and osmolality, 350 mOsm/mL. The specific gravity of urine is 1.002. This patient is most likely to have a deficiency of which of the following hormones?

A 25-year-old woman has noted breast secretions for the last 1 month. She is not breastfeeding and has never been pregnant. She has not menstruated for the past 5 months. Physical examination yields no abnormal findings. MRI of the brain shows a 0.7-cm mass in the adenohypophysis. Which of the following additional complications is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion

question: A 23-year-old woman has a routine health status examination. Her body mass index is 22. Laboratory studies show fasting plasma glucose is 120 mg/dL. Urinalysis shows mild glucosuria, but no ketonuria or proteinuria. She has no detectable insulin autoantibodies. Her father was similarly affected at age 20. She is most likely to have a mutation in a gene encoding for which of the following?

A 51-year-old man has noted increasing weakness and weight gain over the past 5 months. He has experienced low back pain for the past week. On physical examination, vital signs include a temperature of 37.3°C, pulse of 80/min, respirations of 15/min, and blood pressure of 155/95 mm Hg. He has bilateral breast enlargement, testicular atrophy, and a prominent fat pad in the posterior neck and back. His serum ACTH level is low. A radiograph of the spine shows decreased bone density with a compression fracture at T9, Which of the following findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Sella turcica enlargement with erosion on head CT scan
Decreased radionuclide uptake in a thyroid gland nodule
Pulmonary 6-cm right hilar mass on chest radiograph
Left adrenal 10-cm solid mass with abdominal CT scan
Retroperitoneal 5-cm mass at the aortic bifurcation on pelvic MRI scan

question: A 9-year-old girl is brought to the pediatrician due to concerns about her growth. Her parents report that she has consistently been below the 3rd percentile for height and they have noticed a lack of height gain compared to her classmates. Otherwise, she is good at studies. The girl's medical history is unremarkable and she has not experienced any significant illnesses. On examination, her growth velocity is significantly below the expected range for her age, and her bone age is delayed for his height age. What is the most likely cause of the patient's short stature?
After giving insulin to a diabetic patient, what will be the most important observation to monitor for?
Which of the following adrenergic receptors are found in the skin?
Which of the following is an Intermediate-acting insulin?
Which of the following minerals is required to synthesize thyroid hormones, thyroxine, and triiodothyronine?
Which one of the following uses the adenylate cyclase second messenger system?
Which of the following hormones keeps the lysosomal membrane intact?
A second-year MBBS student notices fibers passing to the posterior pituitary. From which part of the hypothalamus are the nerves coming?

A 47-year-old female with hirsutism and amenorrhea for the last 5 years also has alopecia and increased muscle mass with deepening of voice. The biochemistry of serum levels shows increased total serum testosterone levels. Which serum levels would confirm the hirsutism?
Which of the following is the mode of action of steroid hormones?

answers.option: They inhibit gene expression by binding to DNA directly
They bind to a membrane receptor
They bind to an intracellular receptor and initiate transcription of a gene.
They activate a second messenger which activates kinases

question: What is another name for BMI?
Which cells of the pancreas release pancreatic polypeptide?
Which transporter is used by iodine in the formation of thyroid hormone?

A 5-year-old boy was brought by his mother with complaints of excessive biting and excessively placing objects in his mouth. Which of the following statements describes the reason for this behavior according to Sigmund Freud's psychosexual development theory?

answers.option: Oral cavity is a site of pleasure

question: Which of the following is the location of the carotid sheath with respect to the thyroid gland?

A histological section is being observed showing a serous gland of compound tubulo-acinar variety. The secretory unit consists of pyramidal serous cells and specialized pale, low cuboidal epithelial cells. Numerous spherical cell clusters are also scattered. Which of the following structures is being observed?
A research study wants to check thyroid activity in a selected population. Which test will be the most sensitive for that?
A child born to a mother who is suffering from iodine deficiency is likely to be born with which of the following condition?
The blood supply of the thyroid gland is from which of the following?
The pyramidal lobe of the thyroid arises from which of the following structures?
A diabetic patient’s scan showed renal nodules that are PAS-positive, along with tubular atrophy and interstitial fibrosis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old man with an adrenal cortex tumor came to the ER with high blood pressure, an abnormal ECG, and hypokalemia. An excess of which hormone would cause this condition?
What is the most common way of administering insulin?
To observe the pancreas during a laparotomy, which structure should a doctor retract?
In the adrenal cortex, which layer contains cells in cords that anastomose with each other?
Which of the following is a metabolic effect of cortisol?

A 30-year-old man visits the clinic and presents with the complaint of regular hand washing for 2 months. He says that he always wears gloves and keeps washing his hands because he has a fear of contamination. In which of the following stages of psychosexual development has the man experienced problems?
A 45-year-old male develops secondary hypogonadism. Laboratory testing shows decreased testosterone. Which of the following cells are affected?
Which of the following hormones is synthesized and secreted by the pituitary gland?
In which of the following conditions is oxytocin indicated?
The inferior pole of the thyroid shows nodules. The involved structure is derived from which of the following?
